body.p:
Mayfield Ky Feby 11" 1861
To his Excellency
Beriah Magoffin
Respected Sir

At the January term of the McCracken Equity & Criminal Court One J. H. Powell was tried and convicted for grand larceny and Sentenced to a confinement in the Pententiary for the period of one year. Mr Powell was a total stranger in Paducah, had just come there, with the intention of locating there The proof in the case was sufficient to warrant a convictions. And not withstanding the Jury was compelled to fine the verdict. I understood that on account of Mrs Powell the wife of said Powell, that the Jury was willing to sign a petition to your Excellency for his reprieve, Mrs Powell bears the reputation of an estimable lady, she has a little boy, and no one to look to for support except the labor of her husband who is a mechanic, consequently taking all the circumstances into consideration, I would say that on account of Mrs Powell who will hand you this letter, and her little boy, that you would do right to release Mr Powell

Your obedient servant
Thos H. Corbett

To his Excellency Beriah Magoffin
per Mrs Powell } Frankfort Kentucky
